article.title: Signatures of hypermassive neutron star lifetimes on r-process nucleosynthesis in the disk ejecta from neutron star mergers

multiple_choice_question.text: What happens to the disk neutrino luminosity when the HMNS collapses into a black hole?
choices: The luminosity undergoes a sudden decrease.

multiple_choice_question.text: What causes the mean neutrino energies emitted by the disk to drop sharply?
choices: Collapse of the HMNS into a black hole.

multiple_choice_question.text: What correlation does Figure 2 demonstrate regarding HMNS lifetime?
choices: Longer HMNS lifetime correlates with less ejected mass and lower average electron fraction.
Longer HMNS lifetime correlates with more ejected mass and higher average electron fraction.
Longer HMNS lifetime correlates with less ejected mass and higher average electron fraction.
There is no correlation between HMNS lifetime and ejected mass or electron fraction.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the orbital time at the initial disk density peak depend on?
choices: Only the mass of the central object.
Only the radius of the disk density peak.
Both the mass of the central object and the radius of the disk density peak.
Neither the mass of the central object nor the radius of the disk density peak.
